page.title: 08COMMUNICATIONS IN GLENLUCE
page.content: Over 80% of the houses have private{ {telephones}and there are two public telephone boxes.{Mail}brought from Newton Stewart each morning is sorted in the post office and is taken out by postmen in vans or on foot.There is one delivery every day except on Sundays and Post Office holidays.Mail can be posted at the Post Office or in one of the two other{post boxes.} {Television}reception has been improved by having a booster aerial put on Bankfield Fell. People can now also get more {Scottish}programmes. A large percentage of houses now have 2 TV sets, partly due to increase in number of families with computers. More than half of school's families have{videos. The Regional{Library}van which calls in the village once a fortnight is not heavily patronised.
